title: DialogTemplateSchema
description: Represents the serializable schema for a dialog template

Contextual.description: Whether or not this dialog requires context passed to it from the previous dialog

NextDialogKey.description:
Defaults to null

If specified and the Type is Normal, the dialog will have a next button that will take them to the
dialog with this template key

Options.description: A collection of options that can be selected from this dialog that lead to other dialogs.

PrevDialogKey.description:
Defaults to null

If specified and the Type is not Normal, the dialog will have a previous button that will take them
to the dialog with this template key

ScriptKeys.description:
A collection of names of dialog scripts to attach to this dialog by default. The name of a script is just the name
of the class without "Script" at the end.

ScriptVars.description:
A collection of key-value pairs of key-value pairs

Each script that has variables needs a scriptName-Value pair, and the value of that entry is a dictionary of
propertyName-Value pairs

TemplateKey.description: A unique id specific to this template. This must match the file name

Text.description:
The text displayed on the dialog. This can be a string format with injectable parameters, but those parameters must
be injected by a script

TextBoxLength.description:
Defaults to null

If specified and the Type is DialogTextEntry, this will limit the length of the input text box

TextBoxPrompt.description:
Defaults to null

If specified and the Type is DialogTextEntry, this will be the message displayed above the text box

Type.description: The type of dialog this is. This controls how the dialog is displayed.

DialogOptionSchema.description: Represents the serializable schema of a dialog option

DialogKey.description: The key of the dialog this option leads to

OptionText.description: The text displayed for this option
